section.heading: Reporting system for hospitals and blood banks

content.p:
ยง 3124. Reporting system for hospitals and blood banks. All persons,
firms and corporations engaged in procuring blood donations shall report
annually the following information to the commissioner of health:
 a. The amount of whole blood collected.
 b. The amount fractionated.
 c. When fractionated.
 d. How much blood is unused and destroyed.
 e. How much blood is converted and what is it converted into.
 f. Any other information the commissioner finds necessary to have an
accurate picture of what happens to collected blood within the state.
 The commissioner shall make such rules and regulations as are
necessary to create an accurate and complete reporting system.
